channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Neglected park and broken apparatus, 23rd September
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise concerns regarding the severe lack of maintenance at our local park. This space is a vital part of the community, regularly used by families, dog walkers, and residents for recreation and exercise. However, its current condition poses serious safety risks and reflects significant neglect. There are stinging nettles growing unchecked, including at the bottoms of slides and across the grass areas where young children often gather. The ground throughout the park is dangerously uneven, with numerous large holes that cause frequent trips and falls. My 18-month-old child, along with other children and adults, has stumbled multiple times due to these hazards. Several pieces of play apparatus are broken and unsafe, and I personally witnessed a woman fall and buckle her ankle last week. The equipment and infrastructure are old, worn, and in many cases, dangerous. While I can only attach three photos, they represent just a fraction of the issues present. Speaking on behalf of local parents, dog walkers, and residents, we respectfully request that this open space be reviewed for future planned investment and urgent maintenance. I also would like to report that the park is being used as a regular hang out for suspicion characters preying on children and drug users who leave their rubbish and contraband on the floor and urinate openly in front of children. This park is the only one in the area and deserves to be a safe, welcoming space for all. We hope you will take this matter seriously and act promptly to restore it to a standard that reflects its importance to our community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clovelly Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electric Chair Flytip, 23rd September
item.description:
This electric chair has been left on the pavement for over a week now. It is damaged and has been attached to the street sign with a loose thin bike lock by the looks it, for some reason, but that can probably be cut through easily enough.

item.title: Dangerous step in pavement, 23rd September
item.description:
Ravenstone Ave, at the side of Sainsbury's, there is a dangerous step approx 30mm high between two slabs. My wife nearly fell there and could have been seriously injured. The slabs on one side seem to have been lifted by a tree root.

item.title: Old Cherry Tree needs Council care and attention - prune required, 23rd September
item.description:
This has been reported various times over the past 2 years and nothing has been done. Two councillors are now aware. The Tree needs urgent pruning and lopping and is now showing more and more bacterial canker. Surely there is a duty of care with the tree by the council. especially as it is an old cherry tree and they become brittle with age.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing zone Q parking signs, 23rd September
item.description:
The zone Q parking signs on two sign posts opposite Tesco on Terrace Road have been removed. This has allowed people to drive and park freely on the street to shop in Tesco during the parking control times causing a further increase in traffic.
